introduction.subtitle: Your development environment is ready in seconds

items.name: Grunt

items.name: Angular

gettingStarted.title: Grabs Getting Started
gettingStarted.subtitle: Grabs eases your development process by including the most popular tools and libraries that are mostly needed for a development environment and allow you to easily extend with new capabilities.
gettingStarted.description: In order to use Grabs, Node.js, Npm and Grunt must be installed. By applying the steps down below your development environment will be ready to use.

items.name: GRUNT
items.text: You can add Grunt plugins to add more tasks to your project. You can also change the existing configurations from the gruntfile.js file.

items.name: ANGULARJS
items.text: Grabs comes with AngularJS. HTML5 Push State support is active and configurations are done so that all the requests are to the index.html file. You can change this behavior in app/js/config/ng-config.js file.

items.name: BOWER
items.text: With Bower you can manage your external dependencies automatically. All you need to do to get them is to edit bower.json file and issue ./grabs bowercopy command. You can also change the configuration from gruntfile.js file's bowercopy section.

items.name: STYLUS
items.text: Your Stylus files are automatically compiled to CSS and minified. You can configure this behavior in gruntfile.js under stylus section.

items.name: SPRITE
items.text:
This plugin combines images under app/img/sprite disrectory into sprite.png file and without any other interference on your part your CSS styles are produced to use this sprite file instead of the individual image file you wrote in your Stylus file.

Images under app/img/sprite-retina directory are combined as sprite-retina.png to help you support devices with higher pixel density. Other directories are copied into build directory without any processing.

You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under sprite section. Example: app/css/global.styl.

items.name: DEVELOPMENT MODE
items.text: In development mode CSS, HTML and JavaScript files are not minimized or combined. Also images are not compressed. When you use ./grabs command without any arguments, it starts in development mode.

items.name: LIVE MODE
items.text: In Live mode HTML, CSS and JavaScript files are minimized. CSS and JavaScript files are combined into a single CSS and JavaScript file. Images are compressed. File caching is disabled. You can use Live mode by issuing ./grabs live command.

items.name: HTML COMPRESS
items.text: Your HTML files are compressed while being delivered. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under htmlmin section.

items.name: IMAGE COMPRESS
items.text: Your images are compressed automatically. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under imagemin section.

items.name: JAVASCRIPT MINIMIZATION
items.text: Your JavaScript files are minimized with SourceMap support. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under uglify section.

items.name: NOTIFICATION
items.text: Grunt will notify you when errors occur via your operating system's notification system. You can define notifications for tasks that you want. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under notify_hooks section.

items.name: CACHE
items.text: Adding a timestamp to the resulting CSS, HTML, JavaScript and Image sprite files' names allows bypassing your browser's cache. For example: app.min.1408295277445.css

items.name: SERVER
items.text: Provides a basic server. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under connect section.

items.name: LIVERELOAD
items.text: Whenever an HTML, CSS or JavaScript file changes your browser window will be automatically refreshed. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under connect section.

items.name: MULTILANGUAGE SUPPORT
items.text: Add multiple languages to your project. Checkout homepage.

items.name: ESLINT
items.text: ESLint, checks your JavaScript files against a standart list of rules for high quality code. You can change these settings from .eslintrc under rules section.
